name: Go Beyond FTP: Sprint
description:
**Unlock your full potential to SPRINT:**

​

Unleash your explosive **SPRINT** power by enhancing your neuromuscular strength and improving your ability to deliver short, intense bursts of speed with our 4 week focussed plan.

prospects.name: Cash Register
prospects.description:
Over/under intervals, where you alternate going just below and just above threshold, are the foundation of many classic workouts. Cash Register is an adaptation of that idea and comes in the format of a sprint/settle/surge session consisting of 4 intervals that get a little shorter (but not easier) each round.

​

Each interval kicks off with a sprint effort that targets your Neuromuscular (NM) power. Then you settle into a controlled, below-FTP effort that will accelerate the rate at which you can clear lactate from your muscles. You'll finish each effort off with a big surge based on your Anaerobic Capacity (AC). In just 30 minutes, you'll be doing efforts targeting your sprint power, FTP, and AC for an exceptionally well-rounded workout.

​

Support the Wahooligan Tour by [donating to the Davis Phinney Foundation](https://secure2.convio.net/dpf/site/TR?pg=pfind&fr_id=1391) and their programs to help people living with Parkinsons.

prospects.name: NM Progression 1: 2 Sets 3 x 10
prospects.description:
As the title suggests, this is the first of a series of workouts designed to help you accumulate time at and around your NM. While the efforts are short at only 10 seconds, they are intended to be absolutely maximal efforts. As the first session in the NM Progression you will complete 2 sets of 3 x 10 second sprints.

​

Due to the short high intensity efforts involved in this workout, we recommend you complete it in Level mode. This workout is a great time effective session that is great to pair with off the bike strength training.

How will this session progress with future NoVids? Each new session will add more sprints, or more sets or both. By the 5th level you'll be up to 3 sets of 5 Sprints.

​

Find out more about how to apply these sessions to your training [here](https://wahoox.forum.wahoofitness.com/t/new-novids-in-systm/22251).

prospects.name: N. Henderson 5: At the Velodrome
prospects.description:
On a day like today -- warm with clear blue skies -- there's only one place to go: the Velodrome. As a National Champion on the track himself, and having coached countless track athletes, Neal's happy to introduce you to the boards with a series of challenges. You'll start with a little paceline work to ease into things (yes, you'll have to take your pulls). It gets more difficult from there, as you'll need to try to lap the group before hitching a ride with a multiple National and World Champion. You'll finish it off, of course, with a massive Kilometer effort.

​

In between, you'll learn a bit more about how Neal spends his recovery time, from gardening to family walks to time spent in his very own chill-out room.

​

**When to ride: Do this on day 5 of the 7-day plan.**

​

_About: Neal Henderson is one of the most accomplished coaches in cycling and multi-sport. His athletes have won more than 50 World Championships, set numerous world and national records, captured Olympic medals, worn leaders jerseys, and won stages in races like the Tour de France. Neal, a former professional triathlete, has won numerous Coach of the Year awards throughout his career from organizations like the US Olympic Committee, USA Cycling and USA Triathlon. Watch the Introduction to this series to learn more._

prospects.name: Core & Hip Mobility A
prospects.description:
This module is a ground-based session designed to improve mobility through your hips and low back while activating and integrating muscles that are key to core stability. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Inchworm
- Pigeon Stretch
- Hip Bridge w/Knee Squeeze
- Marching Hip Bridge
- Back Extension w/Arms Overhead
- Quadruped w/Alt. Leg/Arm
- Bird Dog
- Kneeling Pelvic Tilt

prospects.name: [BETA] Understanding 4DP pt.1: Neuromuscular Power - NM (The Knowledge Podcast)
prospects.description:
[**Beta Feedback Thread**](https://forum.wahooligan.com/t/the-knowledge-workouts-beta/24072)

​

Most cyclists think Neuromuscular Power is only relevant for sprinters. But in this episode, Neal and Mac break down the myths around NM, examine why neuromuscular coordination drives your efficiency at all effort levels, and explain how sprint training, cadence builds and other drills will make you both a faster and more complete athlete.

​

The Knowledge podcast by Wahoo is a science-based podcast focused on providing training information for endurance athletes. Hosted by sports scientists, it delves into various training topics, offering actionable insights and key takeaways.

[**Find out more**](https://the-knowledge-by-wahoo-sports-science.simplecast.com/episodes)

prospects.name: Sprints: 2 Sets 4 X 10s
prospects.description:
With short near-maximal sprint efforts like these, you'll recruit all of the muscle fibers in your legs. While cadence builds force your muscles to contract and relax as quickly as possible, this session forces your muscles to contract with maximal power. Just like cadence builds, this session becomes one of the best ways to train your neuromuscular system.

​

Even if your target event does not require you to complete maximal sprints, there is a substantial trickle-down efficiency effect to the longer duration power efforts when you train your neuromuscular system.

​

This session is a great alternate to cadence builds or standing starts for those completing our SUF Strength sessions. On days you complete strength work you want your on bike training to complement that work. This means short maximal efforts (whether for power or for cadence) are the best workouts to complement the strength gains you've made off the bike.

You should ride this session in Level, rather than Erg, mode. The only time we would suggest Erg mode is if you can’t maintain the lower power targets set between sprints.

​

As long as you run this session in Level mode you can complete the sprints either seated or standing. For those competing in events that don’t require much (if any) standing (such as Time Trials or Triathlons), you should complete these sprints seated (and in the aerobars or drops if that is where you are racing). You should also do these efforts seated if you don't feel an out-of-the-saddle maximal sprint is stable/safe to do on your trainer.

​

Regardless of using ERG or Level mode, don’t hold back on any sprint. Seeing your peak power drop as the session goes on is totally normal as your legs fatigue. This is where RPE really becomes the most important metric, rather than power, heart rate, or cadence.

​

Now get on that bike and CRUSH IT!

​

**Warm Up**

4 minutes @ RPE 1 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70%

3 minutes @ RPE 3 -- 70% of FTP -- HR <70%

2 minutes @ RPE 6 -- 90% of FTP -- HR <80%

1 minute @ RPE 1 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70%

5 seconds @ RPE 6 -- 120% of FTP -- HR <90% (increase rpm by 5)

5 seconds @ RPE 6 -- 120% of FTP -- HR <90% (increase rpm by 5)

5 seconds @ RPE 6 -- 120% of FTP -- HR <90% (increase rpm by 5)

5 seconds @ RPE 6 -- 120% of FTP -- HR <90% (increase rpm by 5)

1 minute @ RPE 1 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70%

5 seconds @ RPE 6 -- 120% of FTP -- HR <90% (increase rpm by 5)

5 seconds @ RPE 6 -- 120% of FTP -- HR <90% (increase rpm by 5)

5 seconds @ RPE 6 -- 120% of FTP -- HR <90% (increase rpm by 5)

5 seconds @ RPE 6 -- 120% of FTP -- HR <90% (increase rpm by 5)

3 minutes @ RPE 1 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70%

​

**Main Effort**

Number of sets: 2

Rest between sets: 4 minutes @ RPE 1 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70%

Interval repeats: 4

**Interval**

10 seconds @ RPE 10 -- 180% of FTP -- HR <100%

50 seconds @ RPE 1 -- 40% of FTP -- HR <70%

​

**Extra Volume**

NA

​

**Cool Down**

1 minute 20 seconds @ RPE 3 -- 60% of FTP -- HR <70%

1 minute @ RPE 2 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70%

1 minute @ RPE 1.5 -- 45% of FTP -- HR <70%

1 minute @ RPE 1 -- 40% of FTP -- HR <70%

prospects.name: NM Progression 2: 2 Sets 4 x 10
prospects.description:
As the title suggests, this is the second of a series of workouts designed to help you accumulate time at and around your NM. While the efforts are short at only 10 seconds, they are intended to be absolutely maximal efforts. As the second session in the NM Progression you will complete 2 sets of 4 x 10 second sprints.

​

Due to the short high intensity efforts involved in this workout, we recommend you complete it in Level mode. This workout is a great time effective session that is great to pair with off the bike strength training.

How will this session progress with future NoVids? Each new session will add more sprints, or more sets or both. By the 5th level you'll be up to 3 sets of 5 Sprints.

​

Find out more about how to apply these sessions to your training [here](https://wahoox.forum.wahoofitness.com/t/new-novids-in-systm/22251).

prospects.name: The Shovel
prospects.description:
Time to dig deep into the COURAGE mines. No other workout runs the full range of 4DP® metrics like this one. Intervals get harder as they get shorter, pushing your Anaerobic Capacity (AC) to the very limit and ensuring that after each micro-interval, your body recovers just enough to hit and hold your power target for the next interval...even if you don't think you can.

​

The 5 and 10-second efforts hit your Neuromuscular (NM) system hard. No holding back for these short efforts. All out means all out. The 15-60 second efforts all require significant anaerobic energy, but with so little rest, your cardiovascular system never really gets a break. This not only stresses your AC as you try to recover, but it also pushes your Maximal Aerobic Power (MAP) to its limit as your body tries to generate as much aerobic power as possible.

​

Even though there is no single interval in this workout that is longer than 60 seconds, each full set lasts more than 20 minutes, so the unrelenting aerobic stress turns this session into a surprisingly good FTP builder.

prospects.name: Core Focus 01
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve ALL of the muscles that make up your core? You’ve come to the right place. The Core Focus series builds up everything from your hip to your shoulders - front, back, and side._

​

To do this, we’ll take you through a variety of contraction types: eccentric (lengthening), concentric (shortening), and isometric (holding a position). The result? Improved core strength, stability, and endurance. You'll find exercises that carry over into other areas of your body, but all of the moves have a significant impact on your core. Level 1 is ideal for very beginners. Even then, you may find some of these moves challenging if you have never attempted them. That’s ok, take your time and pause the video if you need. Soon you’ll be on your way to mastering your core potential. In addition to a mat, you'll need some open wall space for this routine.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Split Stance Side Bend w/ Arms Overhead
- Downward Dog
- Quadruped T-Spine Rotation
- Back Extension w/ opp arm & leg raise
- Hamstring Hip Bridge
- Oblique Leg Lifts
- Quadruped w/ alternating arm raise
- Quad w/ leg raises
- Low Side Plank w/ toe-tap front/back
- High Side Plank w/ Hold
- Quad Toes w/ Alternate Arm Raise
- Quadruped Pull In & Hold
- Quadruped Push Out & Hold
- Bird Dogs
- Back Extension with Hold
- Child's Pose

prospects.name: UAE Tour 2
prospects.description:
**Featured Rider: **Andrea Vendrame

**Event:** UAE Tour

**Mission - “Sniper”:** It’s Stage 6 of the UAE Tour and the peloton is entering the final 20km of the race. While not an out-and-out sprinter, you’re the fast man of the AG2R Citroen team. You don’t have a leadout so you’re on your own to grab a result. Do you have what it takes to go it alone and secure the win?

​

**About ProRides**

Here’s your chance to experience what it’s like to ride in the biggest races in the world, thanks to SYSTM’s 4DP platform. We’ve taken the first-person camera footage and power data from a pro cyclist and analyzed it to determine which part of their 4DP® profile each of their efforts corresponds to. But since few of us can put down pro-level watts, we made it so all of the efforts are scaled to your own personal 4DP® profile. That means you get to experience exactly what the pros experience relative to your own abilities. When they sprint, you sprint. When they attack, you attack. When they sit up, you get to take it (relatively) easy. It's the most immersive, realistic race simulation out there.

​

[Here's some more information on how to create the most immersive ProRides experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterProRides)

​

**Featured Footage: **Velon

prospects.name: NM Progression 3: 3 Sets 3 x 10
prospects.description:
As the title suggests, this is the third of a series of workouts designed to help you accumulate time at and around your NM. While the efforts are short at only 10 seconds, they are intended to be absolutely maximal efforts. As the third session in the NM Progression you will complete 3 sets of 3 x 10 second sprints.

​

Due to the short high intensity efforts involved in this workout, we recommend you complete it in Level mode. This workout is a great time effective session that is great to pair with off the bike strength training.

How will this session progress with future NoVids? Each new session will add more sprints, or more sets or both. By the 5th level you'll be up to 3 sets of 5 Sprints.

​

Find out more about how to apply these sessions to your training [here](https://wahoox.forum.wahoofitness.com/t/new-novids-in-systm/22251).

prospects.name: Galicia: Muros to Ezaro
prospects.description:
Waterfalls? Check. Fishing villages? Check. Clear sky and blue sea? Yep. Unbelievable coastline that makes you actually consider moving your entire life to this incredible region? Well then, we must be in Galicia for another On Location workout. This time, we’re sticking close to the coast and avoiding the hills\* so we can get in a fantastic sprint session while taking in some of the main tourist attractions (\* Except for that nasty one at the end. But let’s just ignore that for now.)

​

If you're looking to improve your sprint and improve your neuromuscular coordination, while finishing off with a solid threshold climb, then look no further than this workout.

​

[**Route on Strava**](https://www.strava.com/activities/7397420116)

​

_Your Host: There are few people who know the mountains and roads of Europe better than Wahoo Ambassador Michael Cotty. As founder of The Col Collective, Mike has made a career out of riding, filming, and telling the story of epic rides and mountains across the continent. As your On Location co-creator and host, Mike's engaging character, curious mind, and friendly nature will have you cueing up your next ride with him before you've even finished the cool-down._

prospects.name: Basic Yoga Poses
prospects.description: Throughout the SYSTM yoga program there are several basic, foundational moves that form the core of the routines. This session takes you through those moves in detail so you can master them and their more difficult variations.

prospects.name: The Other French Race
prospects.description:
🎬 Film: Rupert Guinness entered the Haute Route Alps in France looking for a new challenge to test his physical and mental strength. But after 800km of cycling through the Alps from Nice to Megève, the cycling journalist and author realized that the experience had delivered to him and the 400-plus starters something far greater. It had provided them with the adventure of a lifetime; from a sense of what it would be like to ride in the fabled Tour de France that he has reported on more than 30 times, to the creation of friendships with fellow riders forged by their shared suffering and encouragement for one another as they cycled through some of the toughest and most spectacular mountains that cycling has to offer.

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

prospects.name: The Meaning of Ride (SBT GRVL® )
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2023): Each August, 3,000 riders converge in Steamboat Springs, Colorado to line up at one of the biggest gravel cycling events on earth. Top professionals from around the world compete for a share of the $22,000 prize purse alongside amateurs participating in their very first race. While every cyclist arrives prepared to undertake the physical and mental challenge, they all have their own unique story, and road that led them to the starting line. The Meaning of Ride follows three athletes from diverse backgrounds as they prepare for, and compete, at SBT GRVL with individual goals of winning, healing, and saving lives.

​

🚴 Workout: This is a very low-intensity recovery ride. It's so easy that your power remains at or below 55% of FTP or an RPE less than 3, and your heart rate stays in zone 1 the entire time. The intensity and cadence targets will vary throughout this session to keep it interesting

prospects.name: No Place Like Home
prospects.description:
Have you been riding, but not riding too hard? Have you been putting in lots of easy and endurance rides but not much intensity? Are you ready to bring intervals back into your routine, but not quite prepared to face up to a session like _Nine Hammers_ or _The Shovel_? Then this is the session for you.

​

If you love _Recharger_ then you're going to tough love_ No Place Like Home_ - the perfect re-introduction to a little bit of hard work. It will wake up your legs, lungs and mind, reminding them what it means to dig deep but without really working too hard or for too long. The workout is expertly designed by Wahoo's Head of Sports Science, Sir Neal Henderson, as a gradual step back into Suffering when self-doubt has taken hold of you and motivation may be low. While you’re riding it, you'll soon realize that you're stronger than you think and that you _can_ work hard. You'll also realize that you really shouldn't have ever left Sufferlandria -- Border Control takes these things very seriously.

​

And when the session is finished? A wave of endorphins kicks in - and if you’ve done it right, you'll feel a sense of elation and a little sting in the legs that reminds you why you were born to Suffer and why there truly is..._No Place Like Home._

prospects.name: Shoulder & Upper Back Mobility A
prospects.description:
This session is designed to improve motion through your shoulders and upper back as well as activate muscles that are key for upper body stability and posture. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality range of motion. Do not move into pain. If you have tingling or numbness from any of these movements stop and consult a medical professional. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Forward Shoulder Rolls
- Backward Shoulder Rolls
- Standing T-Spine Rotation
- Standing Scapular Retraction
- Wall Angels
- Scapular Depression
- Quadruped w/Alt. Arm Raise
- Quadruped w/Push Out
- Quadruped w/Pull In
- Downward Dog
